website_summaries.verdict: The Belkin Network USB Hub provides a simple way for multiple users to share USB devices wirelessly. It's a must for any multiuser household.
pros: Easy to set up and use
can wirelessly network up to five devices at once
cons: Some software firewalls impede communication (but Belkin provides step-by-step workarounds)
not all USB devices are supported
only Windows XP and Vista are supported so far

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT compatible with Windows 10!!
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like a great low cost sharing solution. I should have investigated further. It is not compatible with Windows 10. Belkin says they probably won't ever make it compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Wireless USB hub unique, and a definite winner!
customer_reviews.text: I did some research on this prior to purchase:it is the only wireless USB hub made now.It works very well,allowing me to only have 3 cords (power,ext.speakers,cooling tablet)plugged into my laptop,instead of 6!This makes my laptop more portable for not having a tangle of wires to unplug to go mobile!It works well with my simple Linksys wireless router(WRT54G),and provides seamless access to my external hard drive,a serious worry prior to purchase.Per online warnings,I have not plugged my webcam into it,doing that directly to the laptop when in use.Also,my WIFI-compatible printer has had no problems working with the hub,another worry prior to purchase.A fine product,highly recommended for wireless folk or those wanting such!
customer_reviews.author: D Winkelried

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: For me, at least, this item has been an absolute piece of junk. Connection speed on my wired network is very slow and once connected there always seems to be some kind of failure. Software hangs my system frequently even after verifying that I have the latest and greatest drivers. I'm hopping I can return it to the seller because it has been worthless to me. XP Pro, SP3, All Firewalls turned off, and Belkin Hub white papered... what a joke... I'll just build up a USB device server and connect it to my network. Steve MCP
customer_reviews.author: Steve from Maine

customer_reviews.title: Simple, functional IP-to-USB bridge
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this to attach a USB software license dongle to a virtual machine running in Xen Server. The "recommended" solutions for this are priced in the hundreds of dollars which seems a little bit unreasonable for an IP-to-USB bridge. After some hiccups during setup, I've got it sitting on a rack in our data center and it has worked well in the month or two we had had it. I've tested in on both Windows XP and Windows 7. Basically, it does what it says it is going to do with a minimum amount of hassle and at a lesser price than other solutions I found. What is not to like?
customer_reviews.author: Robert D Ericsson

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: On of the things that appealed to me about the Belkin F5L009 network hub was that it *seemed* to match my Airport Extreme wireless router in size and shape, such that I was hoping to stack the two together on my "network shelf" at home. Though the specs indicated that the F5L009 was larger than the Airport, I took a gamble and ordered it anyway. It was a perfect match! The main reason I wanted this product was so I could run printer utilities that didn't work against printers connected directly to the Airport. For that it worked exactly as advertised! Now all I need is a matching cable modem.
customer_reviews.author: Luekutus

customer_reviews.title: Great Component for a Small Office
customer_reviews.text: This gadget is great! Makes having USB printers, scales and the like accessible by any workstation on the network. You can program all printers to automatically connect to the server and thus available to workstations via the printer menu, or you can permit each workstation to manually sign-on for a weighing scale or other device.
customer_reviews.author: Jon W.

customer_reviews.title: Great to Extend USB Connection
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use to connect a USB 433mhz receiver (RFXcom unit) for Homeseer. I needed to have the receiver in the middle of my home for best signal reception. Setup was a breeze and I am running it on Windows 7 32bit by using drivers available on the site. I would most always go to the products website to get the latest drivers over using the possible older driver versions on the CD. Works great for my application.
customer_reviews.author: M Miraglia

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: I am using Windows 7 and this product worked as it says- in 3 minutes with my linksys 310n router and canon mp460 printer. I have not tried the drives yet but will update as I try them. Before installing I went to belkin website if there was any firmware upgrade but there is none. It even doesnt say whether it will work with windows 7 32 bit but then I took a gamble and intalled it. Worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: dr_rks

customer_reviews.title: Hub - Great silent Partner
customer_reviews.text: The Belkin F5Loo9 Network Hub has been a flawless transition. There have been no problems installing and hooking it up to work in my system and it is a true "silent partner" sitting on the shelf doing its thing to make sure I can print from anywhere in the office without having to be hardlined into the system. Having the wireless access to my printers has been very helpful in my business. I highly recommend this product for someone looking to have that access.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G. Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Works well once set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, and does what it's supposed to do. I can see set up might be difficult, since you have to do an install on every machine that accesses the hub. Otherwise, if you have a little computer knowledge this device is helpful for managing printers and hard drives you want to share across multiple computers.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Lake

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Cool
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this as a central hub through out my apartment. I have a couple different things connected to it at the same time (mostly keyboards really ) and nothing bad so far. My only gripe is that it didn't do the one thing I bought it for. I got a 10" Mimo Touch Screen monitor and I wanted to have that attached to this, but because of power restrictions it didn't work out that way. From reading the description before I got it I knew this could be a possibility so I was expecting it. Other than that, I'm surprised this is the only one I could really find online. Pretty good device.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a a refurbished item when Belkin dropped it from their product line. The unit functions well and meets my expectations. A note to the seller though, usually refurbishing a product includes wiping the sticky fingerprints off the case.
customer_reviews.author: P. J. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Works - nuff said
customer_reviews.text: Worked right out of the box. Very easy installation on my mac book and I had two external storage drives up and running on my network. Easy to set up and run and has been working like a charm since it was first set up.
customer_reviews.author: Chef Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great for home use
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for home use so that we could send print jobs from multiple computers to one printer. It is extremely easy to set up, very flexible (the feature to keep the printer "on standby" until needed is perfect) and has performed exactly as we hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Emily R

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: I run 6 computers, 5 are wired and 1 is a wireless notebook. I find it convenient to have an external USB hard drive and a 4 gb flash drive plugged into this hub. I've had no connection problems with any of my various model computers.
customer_reviews.author: Howie

customer_reviews.title: Cute Idea, FAIL in the Real World
customer_reviews.text: This item looks a lot more sturdy than it really is. It's very lightweight and feels cheap. I have a Mac and a PC at home and tried connecting some external USB hard drives through this device for sharing iTunes libraries and backup disks. My backup disk needed a repair after the fact. The hub actually worked fine on my Mac, but the drivers (latest) were giving problems on the PC and I could never get the hard drives to show up for more than 5 minutes. I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Fran Carstens

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Love it! When my desktop died I lost the ability to link my external storage devices to my laptop. This is great - I have two external drives linked. Easy setup, small, fast, just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: ibayoung

customer_reviews.title: Not a good purchase for external HDs.
customer_reviews.text: If I had taken the time to actually do the math on this I could have saved my money. Simply put, this device is not practical for use with external drives. USB 2.0 operates at 400+ Mbps and if connected through a standard connection your harddrives will be restricted to the 100Mbps over the lan. I wish I had considered that before I purchased. This does work well as a network printer connection or for any other USB devices that don't need a higher speed transfer rate.
customer_reviews.author: Wolverine_Hawaii

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - a must for home networking.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a home network, network printer, and network drive then this is the product for you. The only Down side is that usb drives perform a little slow. My Canon Multipass works great.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Does everything it is supposed to
customer_reviews.text: I installed this USB hub to the router and it worked instantly. All wireless PCs can easily use the printer attached to the hub after the Belkin software is installed. I also wanted to use the hub to use USB game controllers that would control a PC in the next room with a component cable out to the TV in the family room. The hub worked great with no network lag time.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lidinsky

customer_reviews.title: Good, reliable
customer_reviews.text: I am using VMWare to run multiple computers in my household. Problem is, my wife's computer is physically located away from the server with no easy way to connect USB devices, such as headsets. Using the Belkin Network USB Hub allows an easy way of connecting those devices as well as sharing other peripherals among several computer systems with simple instructions. If you need to add remote USB peripherals, or share USB peripherals with several computers, this product is good answer.
customer_reviews.author: L. Price

customer_reviews.title: as promised
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this with a Belkin pre-N router, and the set-up was as easy as promised. Only glitch has nothing to do with the hub, but with my current Samsung printer (which doesn't like Macs)
customer_reviews.author: Medhat

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with my setup
customer_reviews.text: I currently have VMWare ESXi and wanted to use this product to be able to use usb devices on my virtual server(s) running Server 2008. Unfortunately i did not investigate this product enough and found out when installing that it does not support server 2008 x64. This product does however work great on my windows vista and windows 7 pcs.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Powell

customer_reviews.title: This thing sucks
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a complete piece of crap. Worked fine when I had Leopard, but once I upgraded to Snow Leopard, it got super flakey. The network control center (Belkin software that manages the hub and connected devices) shows my Brother printer as connected, but when I try to print something, the Apple print manager shows the device as not connected. What a piece of crap. Save yourself frustration and just use a usb wire.
customer_reviews.author: Electronics buff

customer_reviews.title: Belkin 5-Port Hub Barely does the job
customer_reviews.text: I have several PC's in the home and one iMac. The iMac does not even see the Belkin and it is difficult to connect and disconnect to printers from different PC's. You have to manually disconnect and hand over to another PC. Not very seemless. It is way slow. Printing to this device .vs. having the printer connected to your PC is probably 3 to 4 times slower. So, in summary, it works but not as easy as you would hope and certainly not as fast.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Locke

customer_reviews.title: SOFTWARE DETECTED HUB, BUT  IGNORED WHAT I PLUGGED IN
customer_reviews.text: My pc could not find the hub at all. However, my mac did. Neither one could update the firmware as the documentation is not current. NONE of my devices were dectected ( I have 4 external drives, 7 flash drives, 2 printers, and other usb devices). I returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: JBlongz

customer_reviews.title: great Idea but ....
customer_reviews.text: I got it and I tried it out with external Harddrives. It worked to a certain degree. I have an Apple and PC enviroment - The Belkin unit doesn't like this at all It only works well with certain formated harddrives - and it messed up the filestructure of one of my harddrives - It took 4 days and about 8 programms to get my data back. my personal decision it is now a nice dust catcher and I spend a little bit more to get a NAS. I still hope that there will be something reliable coming out.
customer_reviews.author: Peter D. Jansen

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I use the USB network hub to print from two printers and to access a USB hard drive from two computers. Setup was easy. The device works all the time. It is great! Only one device can be attached to a computer at a time through the hub. It would be a nice future enhancement if the hub could automatically handle multiple device requests from multiple computers.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Eveler

customer_reviews.title: Super Fast Shipping and Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Very good product, super fast shipping, ease of use. The only negative point is the transfer rate.. it is good for printers and photos .. but I was using for huge data transfers of more than 60 GB and it is slow on these transfers.
customer_reviews.author: Krishnamoorthy Venkataramanan

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR SCANNERS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I picked up this product for our office in order to share a few devices, mainly a Xerox auto-feed scanner. Installation went great, very easy and straightforward. But then it came time to get the scanner working. No dice. All the computers can see it, but nothing works. So its onto the phones with Belkin. They are helpful but they oh so politely inform me that it WONT WORK WITH A SCANNER!!!! Bah! Why couldn't they just include that in the advertising??? Just one little disclaimer couldn't be that hard. So get this if you need to hook up a printer or . . . yea. . .a printer. Otherwise just skip it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I didn't do 5 stars is because it doesn't support Ubuntu. For my Vista box it is working really good. Please vendors start supporting Linux. That is all.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not good for a webcam
customer_reviews.text: It was difficult to set up the hub. Than when it was setup the connection speed was so slow the webcam which was the real reason it was purchased was so grainy it was unusable. For other devices that don't need a quick connection it works fine but don't purchase for use with a webcam.
customer_reviews.author: boarder

customer_reviews.title: Works for Mac...Kinda...
customer_reviews.text: While Belkin has created software that makes this compatible with mac osx, they are far from making it user friendly or reliable. The software is not available on the CD, you must download it from their website. As far as I have been able to make it work, you cannot auto mount and dismount a printer, and the software tends to crash relatively frequently. I don't hate it enough to return it, but almost.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Roudabush

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Works great with very good support good product, works great with ESXi good with smart cards, also works with vmware
customer_reviews.author: Avi Sofer

customer_reviews.title: Slow connection
customer_reviews.text: In theory this is an awesome product. Unfortunatelly Vista + Norton + LaCie external HDD seems to have problems working together. I'm going to contact Belkin to see if there's anything to do about the ridiculously long connection time (even after totally disabling Norton). Otherwise, once the explored finally has located the HDD it works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it is a Win 7 thing a personal thing with my computer or what - I don't care - it didn't work for me. Not all devices supported and then my Win 7 PC started getting BSOD. I finally gave up on the unit. Nice idea but failed in execution. Does not appear Belkin is producing any more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Tomish

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant little product
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as described. Install the software, then plug it in. Plug in other USB devices, and they all just magically work wirelessly. Never had any issues with it...
customer_reviews.author: i_like_apples

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product
customer_reviews.text: The product is not usable. I tried it with an external HDD, a webcam. In both cases, I was able to connect to the devices, but not use the devices. I also downloaded the Silex driver for Windows 7, that did not help. Completely useless product.
customer_reviews.author: Kazi

customer_reviews.title: Belkin usb hubxyz
customer_reviews.text: The hub was exactly as marketed and worked the first time I connected it. I use it for a print server on my home network and it has worked flawlessly
customer_reviews.author: C. Mausbach

customer_reviews.title: Not Easy to get it to work
customer_reviews.text: Tried to use this though a router and could not figure it out. Instructions are not as good as they could be.
customer_reviews.author: H. J. Collier

customer_reviews.title: Not Compatible With Any Version Of Windows 7...
customer_reviews.text: Not Compatible With Any Version Of Windows 7... I bought it few months ago and now it is useless piece of garbage. I can't use it, update it, return it. And they still sell it for so much money... Shame Belkin!!! If you have Windows 7 buy LinksKey LKS-PSU04 USB NetServer instead. Its cheaper and works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Jarek Sidorek

customer_reviews.title: difficult to install on Snowleapord
customer_reviews.text: Belkin needs to update their drivers for this product. I managed to get it working after reading lots of message boards and installing it about 10 different times. Now that it is working I like it!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Carsley

customer_reviews.title: buy somthing else :(
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of computers in my network so i thought this would be a great way to connect a lot of usb drives but I use Linux mostly and windows 7. Well you can get it to work with windows 7 but not with the software that it comes with and linux not at all. but other then that it a great product Just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: timandlife

customer_reviews.title: Only for mass storage device
customer_reviews.text: Because it's dosen't work with webcam, scanner, external sound card or other device that are not mass storage. Perfect for hard drive, usb memory or printer sharing over a network...
customer_reviews.author: VB24

customer_reviews.title: Grrrrrrrrrr this is not wireless!!  Beware!!
customer_reviews.text: Product review is not correct. This will connect to a wireless router only through an ethernet cable. This product is misrepresented!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Keller

product_meta.title: Belkin F5L009 5-Port Network USB Hub
product_meta.description:
NETWORK USB HUB

AMAZON.COM
Amazon.com Product Description Your home computers are networked wirelessly, but with all the digital photos, video and music your family has been collecting, they're all running out of hard drive space. And what's more, you and your kids each need access to a printer. With the Belkin Network USB Hub, you can give each computer on your network direct wireless access to up to 15 devices, including an external hard drive to store your family's digital media and a printer that everyone on your network can share. With this convenient, easy-to-install device, the days of purchasing separate printers and peripherals for each of your computers is over. 

 Share up toFifteen Devices Wirelessly
The Belkin Network USB Hub allows you to give every computer connected to your network access to up to 15 USB devices. (The Hub itself will connect directly to five devices, but it also lets you "daisy chain" three additional USB hubs to it, so that you can connect a total of 15 USB devices to your network computers.) While the Hub is specifically designed for printers and mass-storage devices, it also works for most other USB devices, including most standard webcams, keyboards and mice, multifunction machines, scanners, and media readers. 

You can even dock an MP3 player and play music through your USB speakers wirelessly. If your device has a USB connection, chances are that everyone on your network can access it wirelessly. (Some high-speed devices, such as high-definition webcams and video docking stations, may not be compatible with the Network USB Hub.) Once the Hub is set up, you simply plug your USB devices into one of its five USB ports, and the Hub seamlessly installs software that makes USB printers and other devices appear to be connected to your network computers. The convenience of this direct USB-connection emulation requires that only one user be linked to each device at a time. So if your daughter is editing video on the external hard drive, the software lets you contact her to request that she disconnects from the drive so you can access it. With printers, the Hub automatically disconnects users after completing a print job, so that other users on your network can print. 

 Quick and Easy Set Up
Even if you don't have an external hard drive or other peripherals you want your computers to access, the Belkin USB Hub is one of the best ways you can share a printer on your network. It not only effectively functions as the industry's first reliable print server, it's also one of the easiest to install. Set-up takes less than three minutes with the included CD. Simply insert the set-up disk, and in five easy steps you'll be ready to go. If you have the Windows firewall activated on your PC, the Hub will automatically detect it and ask you if you wish to allow it to work from behind the firewall. (Users of other firewalls must manually add the device driver to their list of allowed programs.) 

 While the Belkin USB Hub works best with the Belkin N1 Wireless Router (a router is not included with the Hub), it will work seamlessly with any existing wireless router. The distance and quality of the connection of your computers to your USB devices will depend on the quality of your router and your Internet connection. And aside from having a wireless network and USB devices you want to connect to, the only requirement is that your computers are running Window XP or Vista.

 NOTE: The Belkin USB Hub connects directly to your existing wireless router. The Hub does not have routing capabilities, and does not include a router. You must purchase the router separately.

 Warranty Information
3-year Belkin Warranty

 What's in the Box
Network USB Hub, power supply, RJ45 Ethernet cable, quick install guide, and setup installation CD.
feature_bullets: Allows computers to share USB external hard drives, printers, scanners and media readers wirelessly
Compatible with all wireless routers (router not included)
Network Hub gives network computers wireless access to up to 15 USB devices

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.5 out of 5 stars168 ratings3.5 out of 5 stars
